title: Hayward H-Series Low NOx Heater — Guided Troubleshooting
description: Guided diagnostic flow for Hayward H-Series Low NOx gas heaters (models H150FD–H400FD).

choose_symptom.text: Select the symptom or fault code you are diagnosing:

no_power.text: Verify incoming power and control fuse integrity.

check_transformer.text: Check transformer output between secondary leads — should measure 24–28 VAC.

check_fuse.text: Inspect 3A fuse on control board. Is it intact?

check_display.text: Is the display or LED now powered and readable?

code_lo.text: The 'LO' fault indicates low water flow or an open pressure switch. Ensure the system is primed and circulating water.

check_pressure_switch.text: With pump running, test continuity across the pressure switch. Should read CLOSED (0 Ω).

check_filter_blockage.text: Check filter, valves, and heater bypass for restriction.

code_if.text: The 'IF' fault indicates ignition failure. Begin by verifying igniter voltage at ignition control module (should be 120 VAC).

check_flame_signal.text: Measure flame rectification signal at control board. Minimum 1.5 µA DC required for stable flame sense.

code_hi.text: The 'HS' or 'HI' fault means water temperature exceeded safe limit. Check water flow and high-limit sensor.

test_high_limit.text: Test both high-limit sensors for continuity (should read closed under 135°F).

flame_loss.text: Burners ignite but shut down after a few seconds — likely poor flame sense or ground.

check_ground.text: Verify heater has solid earth ground and ground continuity to control board.

short_cycle.text: Heater turns on and off frequently — may indicate thermostat or flow instability.

end_power_issue.text: ⚠️ Restore power source or verify breaker and wiring. Heater will not operate until 120/240V is present.

replace_transformer.text: Replace the 24V transformer. Confirm output within 24–28 VAC after installation.

replace_fuse.text: Replace the 3A fuse on the board and recheck display operation.

replace_board.text: Replace control board and verify display initialization.

replace_pressure_switch.text: Replace defective pressure switch and re-test system.

replace_flow_related_components.text: Consider replacing pressure switch, internal bypass, or inspect header manifold for debris.

replace_ignition_control.text: Replace ignition control module. Verify proper voltage to igniter and retry ignition sequence.

clean_flame_sensor.text: Clean flame sensor with emery cloth and verify signal above 1.5 µA DC.

replace_high_limit.text: Replace faulty high-limit sensor(s) and verify heater shuts off properly near 135°F.

repair_ground.text: Restore or reattach ground connection between heater chassis and electrical system.

replace_thermostat.text: Replace main thermostat or temperature control board.

replace_gas_valve.text: Replace gas valve if cycling irregularly or pressure inconsistent.

end_success.text: ✅ Heater operating normally after corrective action.

end_pump_off.text: Ensure circulation pump is turned on and primed before testing again.

end_other.text: Document observed issue for further review or manufacturer support.

end_retest.text: Re-test heater operation after restoring power and controls.
